snippet: Concern over the wage and income trends of the last decade, when pay stagnated for middle-class families, could make it more difficult for Democrats to advocate for across-the-board tax increases if a deal falls through.
abstract: News analysis; income stagnation that has hit middle-class Americans in the last decade is complicating Democrats’ position in fiscal talks, making it more difficult for them to advocate across-the-board tax increases if a deal falls through; high-income taxpayers will bear brunt of impact if Pres Obama and Congress fail to reach agreement, but taxpayers at all levels will be affected.
lead_paragraph: Concern over the wage and income trends of the last decade, when pay stagnated for middle-class families, could make it more difficult for Democrats to advocate for across-the-board tax increases if a deal falls through.

headline.seo: Middle Class Malaise Complicates Democrats’ Fiscal Stance
headline.main: Income Malaise of Middle Class Complicates Democrats’ Stance in Talks
headline.print_headline: Income Malaise of Middle Class Complicates Democrats’ Stance in Talks
